intro: Daniellia thurifera var. chevalieri, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its smooth, grey bark and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by small, round, greenish fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
